document_notes.text:
This update for git fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2024-24577: Fixed arbitrary code execution due to heap corruption in git_index_add (bsc#1219660)
document_notes.title: Details

notes.text: libgit2 is a portable C implementation of the Git core methods provided as a linkable library with a solid API, allowing to build Git functionality into your application. Using well-crafted inputs to `git_index_add` can cause heap corruption that could be leveraged for arbitrary code execution. There is an issue in the `has_dir_name` function in `src/libgit2/index.c`, which frees an entry that should not be freed. The freed entry is later used and overwritten with potentially bad actor-controlled data leading to controlled heap corruption. Depending on the application that uses libgit2, this could lead to arbitrary code execution. This issue has been patched in version 1.6.5 and 1.7.2.
notes.title: Vulnerability Description
